field.name: Account
field.comment: Account mnemonic as agreed between buy and sell sides, e.g. broker and institution or investor/intermediary and fund manager.

field.name: FilledQuantity
field.comment: Total quantity (e.g. number of shares) filled.

field.name: Currency
field.comment: Identifies currency used for price. Absence of this field is interpreted as the default for the security. It is recommended that systems provide the currency value whenever possible. See "Appendix 6-A: Valid Currency Codes" for information on obtaining valid values.

field.name: TradeId
field.comment: Unique identifier of execution message as assigned by sell-side (broker, exchange, ECN) (will be 0 (zero) for ExecType (150)=I (Order Status)). Uniqueness must be guaranteed within a single trading day or the life of a multi-day order. Firms which accept multi-day orders should consider embedding a date within the ExecID field to assure uniqueness across days. (Prior to FIX 4.1 this field was of type int).

field.name: LastPrice
field.comment: Price of this (last) fill.

field.name: LastQuantity
field.comment: Quantity (e.g. shares) bought/sold on this (last) fill.

field.name: OrderId
field.comment: Unique identifier for Order as assigned by sell-side (broker, exchange, ECN). Uniqueness must be guaranteed within a single trading day. Firms which accept multi-day orders should consider embedding a date within the OrderID field to assure uniqueness across days.

field.name: OrderQuantity
field.comment: Quantity ordered. This represents the number of shares for equities or par, face or nominal value for FI instruments. (Prior to FIX 4.2 this field was of type int)

field.name: OrderStatus
field.comment: Identifies current status of order. *** SOME VALUES HAVE BEEN REPLACED - See "Replaced Features and Supported Approach" *** (see Quantity : "Glossary" for value definitions)

field.name: OrderType
field.comment: Order type.

field.name: Price
field.comment: Price per unit of quantity (e.g. per share)

field.name: Side
field.comment: Side of order (see Volume : "Glossary" for value definitions)

field.name: Symbol
field.comment: Ticker symbol. Common, "human understood" representation of the security. SecurityID (48) value can be specified if no symbol exists (e.g. non-exchange traded Collective Investment Vehicles) Use "[N/A]" for products which do not have a symbol.

field.name: TimeInForce
field.comment: Specifies how long the order remains in effect. Absence of this field is interpreted as DAY. NOTE not applicable to CIV Orders. (see Volume : "Glossary" for value definitions)

field.name: SettlementDate
field.comment: Specific date of trade settlement (SettlementDate) in YYYYMMDD format. If present, this field overrides SettlType (63). This field is required if the value of SettlType (63) is 6 (Future) or 8 (Sellers Option). This field must be omitted if the value of SettlType (63) is 7 (When and If Issued) (expressed in local time at place of settlement)

field.name: SettlementType
field.comment: Indicates order settlement period. If present, SettlDate (64) overrides this field. If both SettlType (63) and SettDate (64) are omitted, the default for SettlType (63) is 0 (Regular) Regular is defined as the default settlement period for the particular security on the exchange of execution. In Fixed Income the contents of this field may influence the instrument definition if the SecurityID (48) is ambiguous. In the US an active Treasury offering may be re-opened, and for a time one CUSIP will apply to both the current and "when-issued" securities. Supplying a value of "7" clarifies the instrument description; any other value or the absence of this field should cause the respondent to default to the active issue. Additionally the following patterns may be uses as well as enum values Dx = FX tenor expression for "days", e.g. "D5", where "x" is any integer > 0 Mx = FX tenor expression for "months", e.g. "M3", where "x" is any integer > 0 Wx = FX tenor expression for "weeks", e.g. "W13", where "x" is any integer > 0 Yx = FX tenor expression for "years", e.g. "Y1", where "x" is any integer > 0 Noted that for FX the tenors expressed using Dx, Mx, Wx, and Yx values do not denote business days, but calendar days.

field.name: PositionEffect
field.comment: Indicates whether the resulting position after a trade should be an opening position or closing position. Used for omnibus accounting - where accounts are held on a gross basis instead of being netted together.

field.name: CancelledQuantity
field.comment: Total quantity canceled for this order.

field.name: AllocationStatus
field.comment: Identifies status of allocation.

field.name: AllocationRejectionCode
field.comment: Identifies reason for rejection.

field.name: OpaqueData
field.comment: Unformatted raw data, can include bitmaps, word processor documents, etc.

field.name: StopPrice
field.comment: Price per unit of quantity (e.g. per share)

field.name: ExecutionDestination
field.comment: Execution destination as defined by institution when order is entered.

field.name: CancelRejectReason
field.comment: Code to identify reason for cancel rejection.

field.name: OrderRejectReason
field.comment: Code to identify reason for order rejection. Note: Values 3, 4, and 5 will be used when rejecting an order due to pre-allocation information errors.

field.name: InstrumentDescription
field.comment: Can be used to provide an optional textual description for a financial instrument.

field.name: Issuer
field.comment: Name of security issuer (e.g. International Business Machines, GNMA). see also Volume 7: "PRODUCT: FIXED INCOME - Euro Issuer Values"

field.name: MinQuantity
field.comment: Minimum quantity of an order to be executed. (Prior to FIX 4.2 this field was of type int)

field.name: DisplayedQuantity
field.comment: The quantity to be displayed . Required for reserve orders. On orders specifies the qty to be displayed, on execution reports the currently displayed quantity.

field.name: QuoteId
field.comment: Unique identifier for quote

field.name: ExpireTime
field.comment: Time/Date of order expiration (always expressed in UTC (Universal Time Coordinated, also known as "GMT") The meaning of expiration is specific to the context where the field is used. For orders, this is the expiration time of a Good Til Date TimeInForce. For Quotes - this is the expiration of the quote. Expiration time is provided across the quote message dialog to control the length of time of the overall quoting process. For collateral requests, this is the time by which collateral must be assigned. For collateral assignments, this is the time by which a response to the assignment is expected.

field.name: QuoteRequestId
field.comment: Unique identifier for quote request

field.name: BidPrice
field.comment: Bid price/rate

field.name: OfferPrice
field.comment: Offer price/rate

field.name: BidQuantity
field.comment: Quantity of bid (Prior to FIX 4.2 this field was of type int)

field.name: OfferQuantity
field.comment: Quantity of offer (Prior to FIX 4.2 this field was of type int)

field.name: UrlLink
field.comment: A URI (Uniform Resource Identifier) or URL (Uniform Resource Locator) link to additional information (i.e. http://www.XYZ.com/research.html) See "Appendix 6-B FIX Fields Based Upon Other Standards"

field.name: ExecutionType
field.comment: Describes the specific ExecutionRpt (i.e. Pending Cancel) while OrdStatus (39) will always identify the current order status (i.e. Partially Filled) *** SOME VALUES HAVE BEEN REPLACED - See "Replaced Features and Supported Approach" ***

field.name: InstrumentType
field.comment: Indicates type of security. Security type enumerations are grouped by Product(460) field value. NOTE: Additional values may be used by mutual agreement of the counterparties.

field.name: SecondaryOrderId
field.comment: Assigned by the party which accepts the order. Can be used to provide the OrderID (37) used by an exchange or executing system.

field.name: MaturityMonthYear
field.comment: Can be used with standardized derivatives vs. the MaturityDate (54) field. Month and Year of the maturity (used for standardized futures and options). Format: YYYYMM (e.g. 199903) YYYYMMDD (e.g. 20030323) YYYYMMwN (e.g. 200303w) for week A specific date or can be appended to the MaturityMonthYear. For instance, if multiple standard products exist that mature in the same Year and Month, but actually mature at a different time, a value can be appended, such as "w" or "w2" to indicate week as opposed to week 2 expiration. Likewise, the date (0-3) can be appended to indicate a specific expiration (maturity date).

field.name: LegPrice
field.comment: Price for leg of a multileg See Price (44) field for description

field.name: StrikePrice
field.comment: Strike Price for an Option.

field.name: CoveredOrUncovered
field.comment: Used for derivative products, such as options

field.name: OptionAttribute
field.comment: Provided to support versioning of option contracts as a result of corporate actions or events. Use of this field is defined by counterparty agreement or market conventions.

field.name: Mic
field.comment: Market used to help identify a security. Valid values: See "Appendix 6-C"

field.name: RoutingType
field.comment: Indicates the type of RoutingID (217) specified.

field.name: IssueDate
field.comment: The date on which a bond or stock offering is issued. It may or may not be the same as the effective date ("Dated Date") or the date on which interest begins to accrue ("Interest Accrual Date") (Note tag # was reserved in FIX 4.1, added in FIX 4.3) (prior to FIX 4.4 field was of type UTCDate)

field.name: MarketDepth
field.comment: Depth of market for Book Snapshot / Incremental updates 0 - full book depth 1 - top of book 2 and above - book depth (number of levels)

field.name: MdEntryId
field.comment: Unique Market Data Entry identifier.

field.name: MdUpdateAction
field.comment: Type of Market Data update action.

field.name: MdEntryOriginator
field.comment: Originator of a Market Data Entry

field.name: MdEntryBuyer
field.comment: Buying party in a trade

field.name: MdEntrySeller
field.comment: Selling party in a trade

field.name: MdEntryPositionNo
field.comment: Display position of a bid or offer, numbered from most competitive to least competitive, per market side, beginning with .

field.name: UnderlyingSymbol
field.comment: Underlying security`s Symbol. See Symbol (55) field for description

field.name: TradingStatus
field.comment: Identifies the trading status applicable to the transaction.

field.name: HighPrice
field.comment: Represents an indication of the high end of the price range for a security prior to the open or reopen

field.name: LowPrice
field.comment: Represents an indication of the low end of the price range for a security prior to the open or reopen

field.name: ContraTrader
field.comment: Identifies the trader (e.g. "badge number") of the ContraBroker.

field.name: TradingSessionStatus
field.comment: State of the trading session.

field.name: NumberOfOrders
field.comment: Number of orders in the market.

field.name: ContraBroker
field.comment: Identifies contra broker. Standard NASD market-maker mnemonic is preferred.

field.name: TotalQuantityTraded
field.comment: Total volume (quantity) traded.

field.name: PriceType
field.comment: Code to represent the price type. (For Financing transactions PriceType implies the "repo type" - Fixed or Floating - 9 (Yield) or 6 (Spread) respectively - and Price (44) gives the corresponding "repo rate". See Volume : "Glossary" for further value definitions)

field.name: ExpireDate
field.comment: Date of order expiration (last day the order can trade), always expressed in terms of the local market date. The time at which the order expires is determined by the local market`s business practices

field.name: MultiLegReportingType
field.comment: Used to indicate what an Execution Report represents (e.g. used with multi-leg securities, such as option strategies, spreads, etc.).

field.name: Product
field.comment: Indicates the type of product the security is associated with. See also the CFICode (461) and SecurityType (167) fields.

field.name: CfiCode
field.comment: Indicates the type of security using ISO 10962 standard, Classification of Financial Instruments (CFI code) values. ISO 10962 is maintained by ANNA (Association of National Numbering Agencies) acting as Registration Authority. See "Appendix 6-B FIX Fields Based Upon Other Standards". See also the Product (460) and SecurityType (167) fields. It is recommended that CFICode be used instead of SecurityType (167) for non-Fixed Income instruments. A subset of possible values applicable to FIX usage are identified in "Appendix 6-D CFICode Usage - ISO 10962 Classification of Financial Instruments (CFI code)"

field.name: TradeReportTransactionType
field.comment: Identifies Trade Report message transaction type (Prior to FIX 4.4 this field was of type char)

field.name: MarketTradeId
field.comment: Assigned by the party which accepts the order. Can be used to provide the TradeId (17) used by an exchange or executing system.

field.name: OrderCapacity
field.comment: Designates the capacity of the firm placing the order. (as of FIX 4.3, this field replaced Rule80A (tag 47) --used in conjunction with OrderRestrictions (529) field) (see Volume : "Glossary" for value definitions)

field.name: OrderRestrictions
field.comment: Restrictions associated with an order. If more than one restriction is applicable to an order, this field can contain multiple instructions separated by space.

field.name: MaturityDate
field.comment: Date of maturity.

field.name: CashMargin
field.comment: Identifies whether an order is a margin order or a non-margin order. This is primarily used when sending orders to Japanese exchanges to indicate sell margin or buy to cover. The same tag could be assigned also by buy-side to indicate the intent to sell or buy margin and the sell-side to accept or reject (base on some validation criteria) the margin request.

field.name: RoundLot
field.comment: The trading lot size of a security

field.name: MatchType
field.comment: The point in the matching process at which this trade was matched.

field.name: WorkingIndicator
field.comment: Indicates if the order is currently being worked. Applicable only for OrdStatus = "New". For open outcry markets this indicates that the order is being worked in the crowd. For electronic markets it indicates that the order has transitioned from a contingent order to a market order.

field.name: ReversalIndicator
field.comment: Indicates a trade that reverses a previous trade.

field.name: SettlementPrice
field.comment: Settlement price

field.name: TradeReportRejectReason
field.comment: Reason Trade Capture Request was rejected. 4000+ Reserved and available for bi-laterally agreed upon user-defined values

field.name: TradeRegistrationTimestamp
field.comment: Traded / Regulatory timestamp value. Use to store time information required by government regulators or self regulatory organizations (such as an exchange or clearing house).

field.name: TradeType
field.comment: Type of Trade:

field.name: PeggedPrice
field.comment: The value of the reference price that the order is pegged to. This field is only present in OrderFeeds and never sent from the client

field.name: TradeReportType
field.comment: Type of Trade Report

field.name: StrikeCurrency
field.comment: Currency in which the StrikePrice is denominated.

field.name: InstrumentStatus
field.comment: Used for derivatives. Denotes the current state of the Instrument.

field.name: DeprecatedTradeId
field.comment: The unique ID assigned to the trade entity once it is received or matched by the exchange or central counterparty.

field.name: ManualOrderIndicator
field.comment: Indicates if the order was initially received manually (as opposed to electronically)

field.name: LotType
field.comment: Defines the lot type assigned to the order.

field.name: InstrumentGroup
field.comment: An exchange specific name assigned to a group of related securities which may be concurrently affected by market events and actions.

field.name: SettlementMethod
field.comment: Settlement method for a contract. Can be used as an alternative to CFI Code value

field.name: ExerciseStyle
field.comment: Type of exercise of a derivatives security

field.name: StartTickPriceRange
field.comment: Starting price range for specified tick increment

field.name: TickIncrement
field.comment: Tick increment for stated price range. Specifies the valid price increments at which a security can be quoted and traded

field.name: MarketSegmentId
field.comment: Identifies the market segment

field.name: NewsId
field.comment: Unique identifier for a News message

field.name: OpenInterest
field.comment: Open interest that was eligible for assignment.

field.name: LowLimitPrice
field.comment: Allowable low limit price for the trading day. A key parameter in validating order price. Used as the lower band for validating order prices. Orders submitted with prices below the lower limit will be rejected

field.name: HighLimitPrice
field.comment: Allowable high limit price for the trading day. A key parameter in validating order price. Used as the upper band for validating order prices. Orders submitted with prices above the upper limit will be rejected

field.name: QuoteStatus
field.comment: Identifies the status of the quote acknowledgement.

field.name: TradeCondition
field.comment: Space-delimited list of conditions describing a trade

field.name: PutOrCall
field.comment: Indicates whether an option contract is a put or call

field.name: SubscriptionRequestType
field.comment: Subscription Request Type

field.name: QuoteType
field.comment: Identifies the type of quote. An indicative quote is used to inform a counterparty of a market. An indicative quote does not result directly in a trade. A tradeable quote is submitted to a market and will result directly in a trade against other orders and quotes in a market. A restricted tradeable quote is submitted to a market and within a certain restriction (possibly based upon price or quantity) will automatically trade against orders. Order that do not comply with restrictions are sent to the quote issuer who can choose to accept or decline the order. A counter quote is used in the negotiation model. See Volume 7 - Product: Fixed Income for example usage.

field.name: QuoteRequestRejectReason
field.comment: Reason Quote was rejected:

field.name: QuoteRejectReason
field.comment: Reason Quote was rejected:

field.name: Headline
field.comment: The headline of a News message

field.name: ClearingBusinessDate
field.comment: The date when a trade is considered to have happened by the exchange system in market local time. For after hours trading sessions, this can typically be the next day

field.name: Commission
field.comment: Commission. Note if CommType (13) is percentage, Commission of 5% should be represented as .05.

field.name: CommissionType
field.comment: Commission type

field.name: ExecutionInstruction
field.comment: Instructions for order handling on exchange trading floor. If more than one instruction is applicable to an order, this field can contain multiple instructions separated by space. *** SOME VALUES HAVE BEEN REPLACED - See Replaced Features and Supported Approach *** (see Volume : Glossary for value definitions)

field.name: HandlingInstruction
field.comment: Instructions for order handling on Broker trading floor

field.name: SenderCompanyId
field.comment: Assigned value used to identify firm sending message.

field.name: SenderSubId
field.comment: Assigned value used to identify specific message originator (desk, trader, etc.)

field.name: TargetSubId
field.comment: Assigned value used to identify specific individual or unit intended to receive message. ADMIN reserved for administrative messages not intended for a specific user.

field.name: Text
field.comment: Free format text string (Note: this field does not have a specified maximum length)

field.name: ListExecutionInstruction
field.comment: Free format text message containing list handling and execution instructions.

field.name: TradeDate
field.comment: Indicates date of trade referenced in this message in YYYYMMDD format. Absence of this field indicates current day (expressed in local time at place of trade).

field.name: LocateRequested
field.comment: Indicates whether the broker is to locate the stock in conjunction with a short sell order.

field.name: OnBehalfOfCompanyId
field.comment: Assigned value used to identify firm originating message if the message was delivered by a third party i.e. the third party firm identifier would be delivered in the SenderCompID field and the firm originating the message in this field.

field.name: OnBehalfOfSubId
field.comment: Assigned value used to identify specific message originator (i.e. trader) if the message was delivered by a third party

field.name: IoiNaturalFlag
field.comment: Indicates that IOI is the result of an existing agency order or a facilitation position resulting from an agency order, not from principal trading or order solicitation activity.

field.name: MiscFeeAmt
field.comment: Miscellaneous fee value

field.name: MiscFeeCurrency
field.comment: Currency of miscellaneous fee

field.name: OnBehalfOfLocationId
field.comment: Assigned value used to identify specific message originator`s location (i.e. geographic location and/or desk, trader) if the message was delivered by a third party

field.name: AllocationLinkId
field.comment: Can be used to link two different Allocation messages (each with unique AllocID (70)) together, i.e. for F/X Netting or Swaps. Should be unique.

field.name: NotifyBrokerOfCredit
field.comment: Indicates whether or not details should be communicated to BrokerOfCredit (i.e. step-in broker).

field.name: RoutingType
field.comment: Indicates the type of RoutingID (217) specified.

field.name: RoutingId
field.comment: Assigned value used to identify a specific routing destination.

field.name: TradeOriginationDate
field.comment: Used with Fixed Income for Muncipal New Issue Market. Agreement in principal between counter-parties prior to actual trade date. (Note tag # was reserved in FIX 4.1, added in FIX 4.3) (prior to FIX 4.4 field was of type UTCDate)

field.name: StipulationValue
field.comment: For Fixed Income. Value of stipulation. The expression can be an absolute single value or a combination of values and logical operators: value value = value = value value value - value2 value OR value2 value AND value2 YES NO Bargain conditions recognized by the London Stock Exchange - to be used when StipulationType is BGNCON. CD = Special cum Dividend XD = Special ex Dividend CC = Special cum Coupon XC = Special ex Coupon CB = Special cum Bonus XB = Special ex Bonus CR = Special cum Rights XR = Special ex Rights CP = Special cum Capital Repayments XP = Special ex Capital Repayments CS = Cash Settlement SP = Special Price TR = Report for European Equity Market Securities in accordance with Chapter 8 of the Rules. GD = Guaranteed Delivery Values for StipulationType = PXSOURCE: BB GENERIC BB FAIRVALUE BROKERTEC ESPEED GOVPX HILLIARD FARBER ICAP TRADEWEB TULLETT LIBERTY If a particular side of the market is wanted append /BID /OFFER or /MID. plus appropriate combinations of the above and other expressions by mutual agreement of the counterparties. Examples: =60, .25, ORANGE OR CONTRACOSTA, etc. (Note tag # was reserved in FIX 4.1, added in FIX 4.3)

field.name: CreditRating
field.comment: An evaluation of a company`s ability to repay obligations or its likelihood of not defaulting. These evaluation are provided by Credit Rating Agencies, i.e. SP, Moody`s. (Note tag # was reserved in FIX 4.1, added in FIX 4.3)

field.name: UnderlyingCreditRating
field.comment: Underlying security`s CreditRating. See CreditRating (255) field for description (Note tag # was reserved in FIX 4.1, added in FIX 4.3)

field.name: LegCreditRating
field.comment: Multileg instrument`s individual leg security`s CreditRating. See CreditRating (255) field for description (Note tag # was reserved in FIX 4.1, added in FIX 4.3)

field.name: TradedFlatSwitch
field.comment: Driver and part of trade in the event that the Security Master file was wrong at the point of entry(Note tag # was reserved in FIX 4.1, added in FIX 4.3)

field.name: MdRequestId
field.comment: Unique identifier for Market Data Request

field.name: AggregatedBook
field.comment: Specifies whether or not book entries should be aggregated. (Not specified) = broker option

field.name: MdMarket
field.comment: Market posting quote / trade. Valid values: See Appendix 6-C

field.name: MdEntryReferenceId
field.comment: Refers to a previous MdEntryID (278).

field.name: TradingSessionRequestId
field.comment: Unique ID of a Trading Session Status message.

field.name: EncodedUnderlyingIssuer
field.comment: Encoded (non-ASCII characters) representation of the UnderlyingIssuer (306) field in the encoded format specified via the MessageEncoding (347) field. If used, the ASCII (English) representation should also be specified in the UnderlyingIssuer field.

field.name: BidType
field.comment: Code to identify the type of Bid Request.

field.name: BidDescriptor
field.comment: BidDescriptor value. Usage depends upon BidDescriptorTyp (399). If BidDescriptorType = 1 Industrials etc - Free text If BidDescriptorType = 2 FR etc - ISO Country Codes If BidDescriptorType = 3 FT00, FT250, STOX - Free text

field.name: PartyId
field.comment: Party identifier/code. See PartyIDSource (447) and PartyRole (452). See Appendix 6-G - Use of Parties Component Block

field.name: PartyRole
field.comment: Identifies the type or role of the PartyID (448) specified. See Appendix 6-G - Use of Parties Component Block (see Volume : Glossary for value definitions)

field.name: CommissionCurrency
field.comment: Specifies currency to be use for Commission (12) if the Commission currency is different from the Deal Currency - see Appendix 6-A; Valid Currency Codes.

field.name: SecondaryClientOrderId
field.comment: Assigned by the party which originates the order. Can be used to provide the ClOrdID (11) used by an exchange or executing system.

field.name: CrossId
field.comment: Identifier for a cross order. Must be unique during a given trading day. Recommend that firms use the order date as part of the CrossID for Good Till Cancel (GT) orders.

field.name: TradeReportReferenceId
field.comment: Reference identifier used with CANCEL and REPLACE transaction types.

field.name: OddLot
field.comment: This trade is to be treated as an odd lot If this field is not specified, the default will be N

field.name: ClearingInstruction
field.comment: Eligibility of this trade for clearing and central counterparty processing values above 4000 are reserved for agreement between parties

field.name: AccountType
field.comment: Type of account associated with an order

field.name: CustomerOrderCapacity
field.comment: Capacity of customer placing the order Primarily used by futures exchanges to indicate the CTICode (customer type indicator) as required by the US CFTC (Commodity Futures Trading Commission).

field.name: ClientOrderLinkId
field.comment: Permits order originators to tie together groups of orders in which trades resulting from orders are associated for a specific purpose, for example the calculation of average execution price for a customer or to associate lists submitted to a broker as waves of a larger program trade.

field.name: TradingSessionSubId
field.comment: Optional market assigned sub identifier for a trading phase within a trading session. Usage is determined by market or counterparties. Used by US based futures markets to identify exchange specific execution time bracket codes as required by US market regulations. Bilaterally agreed values of data type String that start with a character can be used for backward compatibility

field.name: LegLastPrice
field.comment: Execution price assigned to a leg of a multileg instrument. See LastPx (31) field for description and values

field.name: AllowableOneSidednessValue
field.comment: The maximum amount that execution of one side of a program trade can exceed execution of the other.

field.name: AllowableOneSidednessCurrency
field.comment: The currency that AllowableOneSidednessValue (766) is expressed in if AllowableOneSidednessValue is used.

field.name: PartySubIdType
field.comment: Type of PartySubID (523) value 4000+ = Reserved and available for bi-laterally agreed upon user defined values

field.name: AlternativeMdSourceId
field.comment: Session layer source for market data (For the standard FIX session layer, this would be the TargetCompID (56) where market data can be obtained).

field.name: TradeAllocationIndicator
field.comment: Identifies how the trade is to be allocated

field.name: TradeSubType
field.comment: Further qualification to the trade type

field.name: PegLimitType
field.comment: Type of Peg Limit

field.name: PeggedPrice
field.comment: The price the order is currently pegged at

field.name: LastLiquidityIndicator
field.comment: Indicator to identify whether this fill was a result of a liquidity provider providing or liquidity taker taking the liquidity. Applicable only for OrdStatus of Partial or Filled.

field.name: ShortSaleReason
field.comment: Reason for short sale.

field.name: EventText
field.comment: Comments related to the event.

field.name: AgreementDate
field.comment: A reference to the date the underlying agreement specified by AgreementID and AgreementDesc was executed.

field.name: LateIndicator
field.comment: Indicates if the contrary intention was received after the exchange imposed cutoff time

field.name: DealingCapacity
field.comment: Identifies role of dealer; Agent, Principal, RisklessPrincipal

field.name: DisplayMethod
field.comment: Defines what value to use in DisplayQty (1138). If not specified the default DisplayMethod is 1

field.name: PreTradeAnonymity
field.comment: Allows trader to explicitly request anonymity or disclosure in pre-trade market data feeds. Anonymity is relevant in markets where counterparties are regularly disclosed in order depth feeds. Disclosure is relevant when counterparties are not normally visible.

field.name: PriceProtectionScope
field.comment: Defines the type of price protection the customer requires on their order.

field.name: PegPriceType
field.comment: Defines the type of peg.

field.name: TriggerPrice
field.comment: The price at which the trigger should hit.

field.name: TriggerNewPrice
field.comment: The Price that the order should have after the trigger has hit. Could be applicable for any trigger type, but must be specified for Trigger Type 1.

field.name: RootPartySubIdType
field.comment: Type of RootPartySubID (1121) value. Same values as PartySubIDType (803)

field.name: ApplVersionId
field.comment: Specifies the service pack release being applied at message level. Enumerated field with values assigned at time of service pack release

field.name: ReferenceApplVersionId
field.comment: Specifies the service pack release being applied to a message at the session level. Enumerated field with values assigned at time of service pack release. Uses same values as ApplVerID

field.name: DisplayQuantity
field.comment: The quantity to be displayed . Required for reserve orders. On orders specifies the qty to be displayed, on execution reports the currently displayed quantity.

field.name: SecondaryTradingReferencePrice
field.comment: Refer to definition for TradingReferencePrice(1150)

field.name: DerivativeSettlementMethod
field.comment: Refer to definition of SettlMethod(1193)

field.name: UnderlyingLegSymbolSfx
field.comment: Refer to definition for SymbolSfx(65)

field.name: UnderlyingLegIdSource
field.comment: Refer to definition for SecurityIDSource(22)

field.name: UnderlyingLegAlternativeId
field.comment: Refer to definition for SecurityAltID(455)

field.name: UnderlyingLegAlternativeIdSource
field.comment: Refer to definition for SecurityAltIDSource(456)

field.name: TradePublishIndicator
field.comment: Indicates if a trade should be reported via a market reporting service. The indicator governs all reporting services of the recipient. Replaces PublishTrdIndicator(852).

field.name: ContextPartyId
field.comment: PartyID value within a ContextParties repeating group.

field.name: RiskProductComplex
field.comment: Risk instrument`s RiskProductComplex.

field.name: RiskSecurityGroup
field.comment: Risk instrument`s SecurityGroup.

field.name: RiskCfiCode
field.comment: Risk instrument`s CFICode.

field.name: RelatedPartySubId
field.comment: PartySubID value within a RelatedPartyGrp repeating group.

field.name: RelatedPartyAlternativeId
field.comment: PartyID value within a RelatedPartyAltIDs repeating group.

field.name: RelatedPartyAlternativeSubId
field.comment: PartySubID value within a RelatedPartyAltIDs repeating group.

field.name: AggressorIndicator
field.comment: Used to identify whether the order initiator is an aggressor or not in the trade.

field.name: AllocationAccount
field.comment: Sub-account mnemonic

field.name: CrossType
field.comment: Type of cross being submitted to a market

field.name: LocationId
field.comment: Identification of a Market Maker`s location

field.name: MatchAlgorithm
field.comment: The types of algorithm used to match orders in a specific security. Possilbe value types are FIFO, Allocation, Pro-rata, Lead Market Maker, Currency Calender.

field.name: PriorityIndicator
field.comment: Indicates if a Cancel/Replace has caused an order to lose book priority.

field.name: ReceivedDepartmentId
field.comment: Identifies the Broker / Dealer Department that first took the order.

field.name: SenderLocationId
field.comment: Assigned value used to identify specific message originator`s location (i.e. geographic location and/or desk, trader)

field.name: CrossPrioritization
field.comment: Indicates if one side or the other of a cross order should be prioritized. The definition of prioritization is left to the market. In some markets prioritization means which side of the cross order is applied to the market first. In other markets - prioritization may mean that the prioritized side is fully executed (sometimes referred to as the side being protected).

field.name: MarketId
field.comment: Identifies the Market

field.name: DeskId
field.comment: Identification of a Market Maker`s desk

field.name: LastMarket
field.comment: Market of execution for last fill, or an indication of the market where an order was routed Valid values: See Appendix 6-C

field.name: ReportToExchange
field.comment: Identifies party of trade responsible for exchange reporting.

field.name: ForexRequest
field.comment: Indicates request for forex accommodation trade to be executed along with security transaction.

field.name: Subject
field.comment: The subject of an Email message

field.name: AllocationText
field.comment: Free format text related to a specific AllocAccount (79).

field.name: EmailThreadId
field.comment: Unique identifier for an email thread (new and chain of replies)

field.name: StandingInstructionDatabaseName
field.comment: Name of the Standing Instruction database represented with StandInstDbType (169) (i.e. the Global Custodian`s name).

field.name: StandingInstructionDatabaseId
field.comment: Unique identifier used on the Standing Instructions database for the Standing Instructions to be referenced.

field.name: SettlementInstructionReferenceId
field.comment: Reference identifier for the SettlInstID (162) with Cancel and Replace SettlInstTransType (163) transaction types.

field.name: SecurityResponseId
field.comment: Unique ID of a Security Definition message.

field.name: EncodedListStatusText
field.comment: Encoded (non-ASCII characters) representation of the ListStatusText (444) field in the encoded format specified via the MessageEncoding (347) field. If used, the ASCII (English) representation should also be specified in the ListStatusText field.

field.name: TotalAffectedOrders
field.comment: Total number of orders affected by either the OrderMassActionRequest(MsgType=CA) or OrderMassCancelRequest(MsgType=Q).

field.name: LegalConfirm
field.comment: Indicates that this message is to serve as the final and legal confirmation.

field.name: MaxPriceLevels
field.comment: Allows an order to specify a maximum number of price levels to trade through. Only valid for aggressive orders and during continuous (autoexecution) trading sessions. Property lost when order is put on book. A partially filled order is assigned last trade price as limit price. Non-filled order behaves as ordinary Market or Limit.

field.name: ReportedPriceDiff
field.comment: Indicates that the reported price that is different from the market price. The price difference should be stated by using field 828 TrdType and, if required, field 829 TrdSubType

field.name: RelationshipRiskProductComplex
field.comment: Relationship Risk instrument`s RiskProductComplex.

field.name: RelationshipRiskSecurityGroup
field.comment: Relationship Risk instrument`s SecurityGroup.

field.name: RelationshipRiskCfiCode
field.comment: Relationship Risk instrument`s CFICode.

field.name: BenchmarkCurveCurrency
field.comment: Identifies currency used for benchmark curve. See Appendix 6-A: Valid Currency Codes for information on obtaining valid values. (Note tag # was reserved in FIX 4.1, added in FIX 4.3)

field.name: LegBenchmarkCurveCurrency
field.comment: LegBenchmarkPrice (679) currency See BenchmarkCurveCurrency (220) for description and valid values.

field.name: LegBenchmarkPriceType
field.comment: The price type of the LegBenchmarkPrice. See BenchmarkPriceType (663) for description and valid values.

field.name: ListSequenceNumber
field.comment: Sequence of individual order within list (i.e. ListSeqNo of TotNoOrders (68), 2 of 25, 3 of 25, . . . )

field.name: ListStatusText
field.comment: Free format text string related to List Status.

field.name: NumberOfReports
field.comment: Total number of reports within series.

field.name: PositionCurrency
field.comment: The Currency in which the position Amount is denominated

field.name: ReferenceAllocationId
field.comment: Reference identifier to be used with AllocTransType (71) = Replace or Cancel. (Prior to FIX 4.1 this field was of type int)

field.name: RepoCollateralSecurityType
field.comment: Identifies the collateral used in the transaction. Valid values: see SecurityType (167) field (Note tag # was reserved in FIX 4.1, added in FIX 4.3)

field.name: SettlementSessionSubId
field.comment: SubID value associated with SettlSessID(716)

field.name: TotNoOrders
field.comment: Total number of list order entries across all messages. Should be the sum of all NoOrders (73) in each message that has repeating list order entries related to the same ListID (66). Used to support fragmentation. (Prior to FIX 4.2 this field was named ListNoOrds)

field.name: TotNumAssignmentReports
field.comment: Total Number of Assignment Reports being returned to a firm

field.name: TradingSessionId
field.comment: Identifier for Trading Session A trading session spans an extended period of time that can also be expressed informally in terms of the trading day. Usage is determined by market or counterparties. To specify good for session where session spans more than one calendar day, use TimeInForce = Day in conjunction with TradingSessionID. Bilaterally agreed values of data type String that start with a character can be used for backward compatibility.

field.name: TransferReason
field.comment: Reason trade is being transferred

field.name: UnderlyingRepurchaseTerm
field.comment: Underlying instrument`s RepurchaseTerm. See RepurchaseTerm (226) field for description (Note tag # was reserved in FIX 4.1, added in FIX 4.3)

field.name: AveragePrice
field.comment: Calculated average price of all fills on this order. For Fixed Income trades AveragePrice is always expressed as percent-of-par, regardless of the PriceType (423) of LastPrice (31). I.e., AveragePrice will contain an average of percent-of-par values.

field.name: AllocationTransactionType
field.comment: Identifies allocation transaction type *** SOME VALUES HAVE BEEN REPLACED - See 'Replaced Features and Supported Approach' ***

field.name: TradeInputSource
field.comment: Type of input device or system from which the trade was entered.

field.name: TradeInputDevice
field.comment: Specific device number, terminal number or station where trade was entered

field.name: LegInstrumentId
field.comment: Multileg instrument`s individual instrument`s InstrumentId.

field.name: LegInstrumentIdSource
field.comment: Multileg instrument`s individual instrument`s InstrumentIDSource.

field.name: LegLastPrice
field.comment: Execution price assigned to a leg of a multileg instrument. See LastPrice (31) field for description and values

field.name: LegReferenceId
field.comment: Unique indicator for a specific leg.

field.name: SettlementPriceType
field.comment: Type of settlement price

field.name: SideLiquidityIndicator
field.comment: Indicator to identify whether this fill was a result of a liquidity provider providing or liquidity taker taking the liquidity. Applicable only for OrderStatus of Partial or Filled.

field.name: CrossBidSide
field.comment: Bid side of cross order

field.name: CrossOfferSide
field.comment: Offer side of cross order

field.name: AdvanceTrade
field.comment: Preliminary notification about public trade

field.name: BidPink
field.comment: true if our order participate in BidPrice of BBO

field.name: OfferPink
field.comment: true if our order participate in OfferPrice of BBO

field.name: PinkFlag
field.comment: true if our order present at DepthLevel

field.name: OrderBookGroupId
field.comment: OrderBook can belong to a group, for instance small lots with id 'SMAL'

field.name: OrderBookGroupDescription
field.comment: Description for Id 'SMAL' could be 'Odd lots'

field.name: MainOrderBook
field.comment: true if the OrderBook is main

field.name: Owner
field.comment: Identify 1) individual user as 'user:group' or 'user' 2) group of users by '*:group' and 3) all users by '*:*'. Supported forms depend on the exact message

field.name: OpeningPrice
field.comment: Opening price. Available during pre open and after market open. Used together with OpeningPriceStatus unles official opening price provided

field.name: ClosingPrice
field.comment: Closing price. Yesterday's closing price until market close

field.name: ReferencePrice
field.comment: Reference price provided by exchange

field.name: Imbalance
field.comment: Imbalance represents the difference between the two sides of the book going into a crossing type of situation.

field.name: TickRulesTableId
field.comment: Identifier of the tick rule applicable to an instrument.

field.name: FlushFlag
field.comment: Do flush if true

field.name: ExchangeCreationTimestamp
field.comment: Microseconds since Jan 1st 1970 UTC

field.name: ExchangeModificationTimestamp
field.comment: Microseconds since Jan 1st 1970 UTC

field.name: RetainFlag
field.comment: If set, the order will NOT be deleted at termination of the session in which it was created.

field.name: PriceDisplay
field.comment: Requestuired price display to see the lowest possible tick

field.name: Portfolio
field.comment: Portfolio identifier

field.name: MassQuoteId
field.comment: Key to combine quotes into a single massquote transaction

field.name: TradingStatusDescription
field.comment: Human readable market specific description of the trading status

field.name: Priority
field.comment: Secondary field for sorting depth levels with the same price

field.name: QuoteId
field.comment: Identifier of instance of quote or of its bid side

field.name: OrderId
field.comment: Identifier of an Order or sequence of Quotes

field.name: StartTime
field.comment: Exchange realtime express in localtime in seconds since start of trading day from which to resend data

field.name: Cusip
field.comment: 1 - CUSIP

field.name: Sedol
field.comment: 2 - SEDOL

field.name: Isin
field.comment: 4 - ISIN number

field.name: Valoren
field.comment: D - Valoren

field.name: SecondaryInstrumentId
field.comment: M - Marketplace-assigned identifier

field.name: MarketOrderId
field.comment: Exchange assigned unique order Id

field.name: TargetOrderStatus
field.comment: Only `New` and `Suspended` statuses are meaningfull

field.name: ImpliedFlag
field.comment: Set in depth levels related to implied prices

field.name: ImpliedBidQuantity
field.comment: Quantity of implied bid

field.name: ImpliedOfferQuantity
field.comment: Quantity of implied offer

field.name: BidAtMarket
field.comment: true if the best bid is an AtMarket order

field.name: OfferAtMarket
field.comment: true if the best offer is an AtMarket order

field.name: QuoteWithOrders
field.comment: Indicator that the quote should be sent to market as an order to the exchange. This flag is a last resort, preferably gateway configuration should specify if quote-with-orders should be used

field.name: FeedStatus
field.comment: Indicator that represents the status of the market data feed for an orderbook

field.name: ValidityDate
field.comment: date after which instrument is not valid any more, used for sorting and for cleanup of expired contracts, optional

field.name: UnderlyingOrderBookId
field.comment: OrderBookId of the underlying Instrument

field.name: PartOfBulkTransaction
field.comment: If set this is a hint that the client would prefer that this request is buffered together with requests and not sent to the exchange until an explicit flush is sent

field.name: BidQuoteSide
field.comment: Bid side of cross order

field.name: OfferQuoteSide
field.comment: Offer side of cross order

field.name: CancelSide
field.comment: Buy/Sell to indicate whether it is the Bid or Offer side of the Quote that should be cancelled

field.name: AuctionPrice
field.comment: The indicative uncrossing price,this is the price at which the largest Quantity of orders can be executed and the fewest are left unfilled, normally broadcasted during an exchange auctioning phase

field.name: AuctionQuantity
field.comment: The indicative uncrossing Quantity, normally broadcasted during an exchange auctioning phase

field.name: StopPriceType
field.comment: What price to use as stop price (last, bid, ask)

field.name: UnderlyingPrice
field.comment: Underlying set price for instrument - mapped to fixed base price in OT

field.name: AggressorSide
field.comment: Was it the buyer or the seller who was active and hit an existing order

field.name: QuoteStatusWarning
field.comment: Preliminary warning about quote status change e.g. Crossed or Locked

field.name: ShortSell
field.comment: Short sell indicator

field.name: LastAuctionPrice
field.comment: Uncrossing price of last auction, updated at the end of the auction

field.name: LastAuctionQuantity
field.comment: Uncrossing Quantity of last auction, updated at the end of the auction

field.name: LastAuctionTime
field.comment: Time of last auction, updated at the end of the auction

field.name: BidNumberOfOrders
field.comment: Number of orders at best bid price

field.name: OfferNumberOfOrders
field.comment: Number of orders at best offer price

field.name: BidPriceOriginator
field.comment: Market owner of order at best bid price. Space separated list if many

field.name: OfferPriceOriginator
field.comment: Market owner of order at best offer price. Space separated list if many

field.name: VwapPrice
field.comment: Trading session VWAP price

field.name: Timeout
field.comment: Time interval in milliseconds

field.name: TotalBidNumberOfOrders
field.comment: Total number of bid orders for the instrument

field.name: TotalOfferNumberOfOrders
field.comment: Total number of offer orders for the instrument

field.name: TotalBidQuantity
field.comment: Total quantity of all bid orders for the instrument

field.name: TotalOfferQuantity
field.comment: Total quantity of all offers order for the instrument

field.name: AdvanceTradeType
field.comment: Enumeration for various types of price improvement auctions and trade notifications

field.name: InternalAccount
field.comment: Orc system internal account. Not sent to exchange. Returned with trades.

field.name: QuoteStatusReason
field.comment: Additional explanation why quote has particular status. Used only in case of unexpected status e.g. in failure scenarios

field.name: AdvanceTradeId
field.comment: Unique Id for an advance trade, assigned by the exchange and used to respond to the AdvanceTradeFeed.

field.name: OfficialClosingPrice
field.comment: Used only together with ClosingPrice

field.name: OpeningPriceStatus
field.comment: Used together with OpeningPrice to provide additional information about the opening price e.g. estimated, need more buyers etc. If empty official opening price is assumed

field.name: BidStatusDescription
field.comment: Instrument Bid Trading Status description

field.name: OfferStatusDescription
field.comment: Instrument Offer Trading Status description

field.name: ClosingBidPrice
field.comment: The last bid for the trading day

field.name: ClosingOfferPrice
field.comment: The last offer for the trading day

field.name: ClosingPriceInfo
field.comment: Generic price attribute

field.name: HighPriceInfo
field.comment: Generic price attribute

field.name: LowPriceInfo
field.comment: Generic price attribute

field.name: LastPriceInfo
field.comment: Generic price attribute

field.name: TouchHighPrice
field.comment: Highest (absolute) rate dealt in a trading day

field.name: TouchHighPriceInfo
field.comment: Generic price attribute.

field.name: TouchLowPrice
field.comment: Lowest (absolute) rate dealt in a trading day

field.name: TouchLowPriceInfo
field.comment: Generic price attribute.

field.name: OpeningBidPrice
field.comment: Opening bid price for the trading day.

field.name: OpeningOfferPrice
field.comment: Opening offer price for the trading day.

field.name: OpeningPriceInfo
field.comment: Generic price attribute

field.name: PrevOpeningBidPrice
field.comment: Previous trading day opening bid price

field.name: PrevOpeningOfferPrice
field.comment: Previous trading day opening offer price

field.name: PrevOpeningPriceInfo
field.comment: Generic price attribute

field.name: PrevClosingBidPrice
field.comment: Previous trading day closing bid price

field.name: PrevClosingOfferPrice
field.comment: Previous trading day closing offer price

field.name: PrevClosingPriceInfo
field.comment: Generic price attribute

field.name: TwapPrice
field.comment: The traded average price for deals

field.name: TwapQuantity
field.comment: Deal count used to calculate the TWAP average

field.name: TwapInterval
field.comment: TWAP interval in seconds

field.name: VwapQuantity
field.comment: Deal count used to calculate the VWAP average

field.name: VwapInterval
field.comment: VWAP interval in seconds

field.name: CorporateActionDescription
field.comment: Human readable market specific description of CorporateAction

field.name: MinGuaranteedFillQuantity
field.comment: Orders for less than this quantity, unable to fill from due to insufficient market Quantity, and meeting certain other exchange criteria, will be automatically filled by an assigned market maker

field.name: ParticipationBidQuantity
field.comment: Total bid-side Quantity which a market maker is responsible for automatically filling

field.name: ParticipationOfferQuantity
field.comment: Total offer-side Quantity which a market maker is responsible for automatically filling

field.name: OrderLegPrices
field.comment: Optional array to specify the prices of individual legs

field.name: NostroCross
field.comment: A flag to show that the trade resulted from two nostro orders from participants of the same legal entity

field.name: QuotePriority
field.comment: Used for quote priority on certain markets, e.g. where throttling exists and certain quotes need to pass the throttling queue.

field.name: TradeDescription
field.comment: Generic trade description.

field.name: InterestType
field.comment: What kind of IOI is this Rfq, IOI, RFCross?.

field.name: EntrySource
field.comment: Used to present the interface used for the trade

field.name: ResourceId
field.comment: name/path uniquely Identifying a resource

field.name: ClearingExchange
field.comment: Used to indicate that the instrument is cleared on another security exchange

field.name: StopOrderBookId
field.comment: Identifying the instrument whose StopPrice to watch, if this is different than the instrument of the order

field.name: CancelReason
field.comment: Used to present reason for cancel.

field.name: SubMarket
field.comment: What submarket for this instrument

field.name: PanicFlag
field.comment: Used to specify that the gateway should use the fastest mechanism possible for the operation even if this has undesirable side-effects (such side-effects should be documented per gateway)

field.name: PriceOffset
field.comment: Combo parameter - Price Offset

field.name: MarketSettingsId
field.comment: An Id to a set of additional data/settings/parameters (Account, OrderCapacity, BrokerClient etc) that will be added to the order when sent to the exchange. The same Id mean different parameters on different exchanges, and this is gateway side configuration.

field.name: LastPaidMarket
field.comment: MIC for the market where the last trade happened. Typically used by the consolidated order book.

field.name: Market
field.comment: Which market(MIC) is the depth level valid on, when orderbooks from the same instrument on different markets are merged

field.name: AtTheMoneyPrice
field.comment: The at-the-money price provided by the market. See ENG-125534 for further details

field.name: ShortSellQuantityTraded
field.comment: Number of short-sell shares traded

field.name: ShortSellTurnover
field.comment: Short-sell Turnover

field.name: MonitoredOrderBookId
field.comment: The OrderBook to monitor for changes

field.name: PriceMoveLimit
field.comment: If a single price movement is at least this big, it will trigger the monitor

field.name: SpreadSizeLimit
field.comment: If the spread between ask and bid is at least this wide, it will trigger the monitor

field.name: PriceMovementOverTimeLimit
field.comment: If the movement of a price over the specified time is at least as big as specified, it will trigger the monitor

field.name: WindowSize
field.comment: Time window size in milliseconds

field.name: Movement
field.comment: Absolute movement (typically price movement) during that time

field.name: OrcMarketId
field.comment: Execution destination as defined using the Orc Market Id number of the gateway.

field.name: AlgorithmId
field.comment: Identifies a specific algorithm used for automated trading (typically used for regulatory purposes.

field.name: SharedMemoryIndex
field.comment: Index of a price in shared memory cache for MonitorOrder

field.name: PegType
field.comment: Type of peg

field.name: PegOffset
field.comment: Peg offset

field.name: PositionAffectedUser
field.comment: The user whose positions should be updated and whose limits should be checked

field.name: OldFactor
field.comment: For Fixed Income: Amorization Factor for deriving Current face from Original face for ABS or MBS securities, note the fraction may be greater than, equal to or less than . In TIPS securities this is the Inflation index. Qty * Factor * Price = Gross Trade Amount For Derivatives: Contract Value Factor by which price must be adjusted to determine the true nominal value of one futures/options contract. (Qty * Price) * Factor = Nominal Value (Note tag # was reserved in FIX 4.1, added in FIX 4.3)

field.name: PriceMultiplier
field.comment: This is what we used to call Factor. It is mapped to the Orc field PriceMultiplier: A price multiplier adjusts the theoretical values of contracts to the quoted market prices. In most markets, listed options are quoted as if one option gives you the right to buy or sell one underlying asset. This means that the price multiplier equals 1. Warrants, however, are often quoted as a fraction of the right to one underlying share. For example, if 1000 call warrants are required to buy one share, the price multiplier equals 1/1000, or 0.001. The price multiplier is also used in some currency exchange calculations

field.name: OldContractMultiplier
field.comment: Specifies the ratio or multiply factor to convert from "nominal" units (e.g. contracts) to total units (e.g. shares) (e.g. 1.0, 100, 1000, etc). Applicable For Fixed Income, Convertible Bonds, Derivatives, etc. In general quantities for all calsses should be expressed in the basic unit of the instrument, e.g. shares for equities, norminal or par amount for bonds, currency for foreign exchange. When quantity is expressed in contracts, e.g. financing transactions and bond trade reporting, ContractMutliplier should contain the number of units in one contract and can be omitted if the multiplier is the default amount for the instrument, i.e. 1,000 par of bonds, 1,000,000 par for financing transactions.

field.name: OldLegPriceRatio
field.comment: The ratio of quantity for this individual leg relative to the entire multileg security.

field.name: LegPriceRatio
field.comment: The ratio of quantity for this individual leg relative to the entire multileg security.

field.name: OldPegOffsetValue
field.comment: Amount (signed) added to the peg for a pegged order in the context of the PegOffsetType (836) (Prior to FIX 4.4 this field was of type PriceOffset)

field.name: PegOffset
field.comment: Peg offset

field.name: OldLegQuantityRatio
field.comment: The ratio of quantity for this individual leg relative to the entire multileg security.

field.name: LegQuantityRatio
field.comment: The ratio of quantity for this individual leg relative to the entire multileg security.

field.name: ServiceState
field.comment: Service state enum

field.name: ServiceTypeName
field.comment: Service type name to describe type of service

field.name: ServiceName
field.comment: Name of service

field.name: StateChangeTimestamp
field.comment: Timestamp of state change in microseconds since 1970-01-01 UTC

field.name: LastSynchTimestamp
field.comment: Timestamp of last synchronization in microseconds since 1970-01-01 UTC

field.name: ServiceStatus
field.comment: Service status object

field.name: TradeSource
field.comment: Source of trade

value.name: Snapshot
value.label: Snapshot
value.comment: Request for snapshot only, could be done after or without subscribe

enum.name: InstrumentTypeEnum
enum.description: Indicates type of security. Security type enumerations are grouped by Product(460) field value. NOTE: Additional values may be used by mutual agreement of the counterparties.

enum.name: SettlementMethodEnum
enum.description: Settlement method for a contract. Can be used as an alternative to CFI Code value

enum.name: SettlementTypeEnum
enum.description: Indicates order settlement period. If present, SettlDate (64) overrides this field. If both SettlType (63) and SettDate (64) are omitted, the default for SettlType (63) is 0 (Regular) Regular is defined as the default settlement period for the particular security on the exchange of execution. In Fixed Income the contents of this field may influence the instrument definition if the SecurityID (48) is ambiguous.

value.name: RegularOrFXSpotSettlement
value.label: Regular / FX Spot settlement (T+1 or T+2 depending on currency)

value.name: FXSpotNextSettlement
value.label: FX Spot Next settlement (Spot+1, aka next day)

enum.name: OrderRejectReasonEnum
enum.description: Code to identify reason for order rejection. Note: Values 3, 4, and 5 will be used when rejecting an order due to pre-allocation information errors.

value.name: OrderAlreadyInPendingCancelOrPendingReplaceStatus
value.label: Order already in Pending Cancel or Pending Replace status

enum.name: LotTypeEnum
enum.description: Defines the lot type assigned to the order.

enum.name: CancelRejectReasonEnum
enum.description: Code to identify reason for cancel rejection.

value.name: OrderAlreadyInPendingCancelOrPendingReplaceStatus
value.label: Order already in Pending Cancel or Pending Replace status

value.name: UnableToProcessOrderMassCancelRequest
value.label: Unable to process Order Mass Cancel Request

value.name: Funari
value.label: Funari (Limit day order with unexecuted portion handles as Market On Close. E.g. Japan)

value.name: MarketWithLeftOverAsLimit
value.label: Market With Left Over as Limit (market order with unexecuted quantity becoming limit order at last price)

value.name: Delete
value.comment: Delete level

value.name: DeleteThru
value.comment: Delete from top down to MdEntryPositionNo

value.name: DeleteFrom
value.comment: Delete from MdEntryPositionNo down the bottom

value.name: Ignore
value.comment: Must not be accounted in depth

enum.name: InstrumentStatusEnum
enum.description: Used for derivatives. Denotes the current state of the Instrument.

enum.name: PutOrCallEnum
enum.description: Indicates whether an option contract is a put or call

enum.name: TradingStatusEnum
enum.description: Identifies the trading status applicable to the transaction.

value.name: NotAvailableForTrading
value.label: Not available for trading (end of session)

value.name: PreCross
value.label: Pre-Cross - system is in a pre-cross state allowing market to respond to either side of cross

value.name: Cross
value.label: Cross - system has crossed a percentage of the orders and allows market to respond prior to crossing remaining portion

enum.name: TradingSessionStatusEnum
enum.description: State of the trading session.

enum.name: PositionEffectEnum
enum.description: Indicates whether the resulting position after a trade should be an opening position or closing position. Used for omnibus accounting - where accounts are held on a gross basis instead of being netted together.

enum.name: CashMarginEnum
enum.description: Identifies whether an order is a margin order or a non-margin order. This is primarily used when sending orders to Japanese exchanges to indicate sell margin or buy to cover. The same tag could be assigned also by buy-side to indicate the intent to sell or buy margin and the sell-side to accept or reject (base on some validation criteria) the margin request.

enum.name: WorkingIndicatorEnum
enum.description: Indicates if the order is currently being worked. Applicable only for OrdStatus = "New". For open outcry markets this indicates that the order is being worked in the crowd. For electronic markets it indicates that the order has transitioned from a contingent order to a market order.

value.name: OrderHasBeenAcceptedButNotYetInWorkingState
value.label: Order has been accepted but not yet in a working state

enum.name: PriceTypeEnum
enum.description: Code to represent the price type. (For Financing transactions PriceType implies the "repo type" - Fixed or Floating - 9 (Yield) or 6 (Spread) respectively - and Price (44) gives the corresponding "repo rate". See Volume : "Glossary" for further value definitions)

value.name: Percentage

value.name: FixedCabinetTradePrice
value.label: Fixed cabinet trade price (primarily for listed futures and options)

value.name: VariableCabinetTradePrice
value.label: Variable cabinet trade price (primarily for listed futures and options)

value.name: PerUnit
value.label: Per unit (i.e. per share or contract)

enum.name: OrderRestrictionsEnum
enum.description: Restrictions associated with an order. If more than one restriction is applicable to an order, this field can contain multiple instructions

value.name: ActingAsMarketMakerOrSpecialistInSecurity
value.label: Acting as Market Maker or Specialist in the security

value.name: ActingAsMarketMakerOrSpecialistInUnderlyingSecurityOfDerivativeSecurity
value.label: Acting as Market Maker or Specialist in the underlying security of a derivative security

value.name: ForeignEntity
value.label: Foreign Entity (of foreign government or regulatory jurisdiction)

enum.name: OrderCapacityEnum
enum.description: Designates the capacity of the firm placing the order. --used in conjunction with OrderRestrictions (529) field)

enum.name: CoveredOrUncoveredEnum
enum.description: Used for derivative products, such as options

enum.name: RoutingTypeEnum
enum.description: Indicates the type of RoutingID (217) specified.

enum.name: MultiLegReportingTypeEnum
enum.description: Used to indicate what an Execution Report represents (e.g. used with multi-leg securities, such as option strategies, spreads, etc.).

value.name: IndividualLegOfMultiLegSecurity
value.label: Individual leg of a multi-leg security

enum.name: AllocationStatusEnum
enum.description: Identifies status of allocation.

enum.name: ProductEnum
enum.description: Indicates the type of product the security is associated with. See also the CFICode (461) and SecurityType (167) fields.

enum.name: TradeConditionEnum
enum.description: Space-delimited list of conditions describing a trade

value.name: StoppedStock
value.label: Stopped Stock (guarantee of price but does not execute the order)

value.name: ImbalanceMoreBuyers
value.label: Imbalance More Buyers (cannot be used in combination with Q)

value.name: ImbalanceMoreSellers
value.label: Imbalance More Sellers (cannot be used in combination with P)

value.name: OfficalClosingPrice
value.label: Offical Closing Price (duplicate enumeration - use `AJ` instead)

enum.name: QuoteTypeEnum
enum.description: Identifies the type of quote. An indicative quote is used to inform a counterparty of a market. An indicative quote does not result directly in a trade. A tradeable quote is submitted to a market and will result directly in a trade against other orders and quotes in a market. A restricted tradeable quote is submitted to a market and within a certain restriction (possibly based upon price or quantity) will automatically trade against orders. Order that do not comply with restrictions are sent to the quote issuer who can choose to accept or decline the order. A counter quote is used in the negotiation model. See Volume 7 - Product: Fixed Income for example usage.

enum.name: QuoteRejectReasonEnum
enum.description: Reason Quote was rejected:

value.name: InvalidOrUnknownIssuerOfUnderlyingSecurity
value.label: Invalid or unknown Issuer of Underlying Security

enum.name: ExerciseStyleEnum
enum.description: Type of exercise of a derivatives security

enum.name: ExecutionTypeEnum
enum.description: Used for Trades only

enum.name: TradeTypeEnum
enum.description: Used for Trades only

enum.name: MatchTypeEnum
enum.description: How did the trade happen.

value.name: LockedMarketWarning
value.label: Locked Market Warning

value.name: CrossMarketWarning
value.label: Cross Market Warning
value.comment: Euronext: Request for execution

value.name: PendingCancel
value.label: Pending Cancel (i.e. result of Order Cancel Request)

enum.name: TimeInForceEnum
enum.description: Specifies how long the order remains in effect. Absence of this field is interpreted as DAY. NOTE not applicable to CIV Orders. (see Volume : "Glossary" for value definitions)

value.name: Recovering
value.label: Recovering
value.comment: Out-of-sync with market data detected, maybe some packets missed, processing recovery stream to sync up again, gap-handling, market-data could be partially stale

enum.name: CrossPrioritizationEnum
enum.description: Indicates if one side or the other of a cross order should be prioritized. The definition of prioritization is left to the market. In some markets prioritization means which side of the cross order is applied to the market first. In other markets - prioritization m\ ay mean that the prioritized side is fully executed (sometimes referred to as the side being protected).

enum.name: AggressorIndicatorEnum
enum.description: Used to identify whether the order initiator is an aggressor or not in the trade.

value.name: AuctionSAL

value.name: AuctionHAL
value.comment: Hybrid Agency Liason

value.name: AuctionCOA
value.comment: Complex Order Auction (Strategy)

value.name: AuctionAIM
value.comment: Automated Improvement Mechanism (Internalization)

value.name: AuctionDAIM
value.comment: Directed Automated Improvement Mechanism

value.name: CrossRequest
value.comment: Notification about someone's intention to execute a cross at given price and Quantity

value.name: Clean
value.comment: As a percent of nominal (excluding accrued interest - Clean)

value.name: Dirty
value.comment: As a percent of nominal (including accrued interest - Dirty)

value.name: Rfq

value.name: Ioi
value.comment: IndicationOfInterest: typically instrument, side and maybe Quantity and price are provided

value.name: Cross
value.comment: CrossRequest: I am about to trade with myself on instrument Quantity x, price y, market participants can intervene on either side.

value.name: RfqRequest
value.comment: Rfq Request: typically only instrument sent. I am interested in receiving Rfqs on X

enum.name: AllocationRejectionCodeEnum
enum.description: Identifies reason for rejection.
